title: 6 Easy Ways to Cancel Fortnite Crew's Monthly Subscription

steps.title: Log into http://www.epicgames.com/account in a web browser.
steps.content: Log into http://www.epicgames.com/account in a web browser. Use your email address and password to sign into your Epic Games account .

steps.title: Select Subscriptions.
steps.content: Select Subscriptions . This will be in the left sidebar.

steps.title: Select the cog icon.
steps.content: Select the cog icon. You can find this at the top-right of your Fortnite Crew subscription.

steps.title: Select Cancel Subscription.
steps.content: Select Cancel Subscription . You'll be asked to confirm your decision. Your Fortnite Crew subscription will be cancelled.

steps.title: Open the Settings.
steps.content: Open the Settings. Press the Xbox button on your controller to open the guide, and then go to Profile & system to find Settings . [1] X Research source Use this method if you purchased the Fortnite Crew subscription with an Xbox Series X, S, or Xbox One console.

steps.title: Select Account.
steps.content: Select Account . This will be in the left sidebar.

steps.title: Select Subscriptions.
steps.content: Select Subscriptions . You'll be taken to your subscriptions page. If you're prompted to enter your passkey, enter it now.

steps.title: Locate Fortnite Crew.
steps.content: Locate Fortnite Crew. Your subscriptions should be in alphabetical order.

steps.title: Toggle off "auto-renewal".
steps.content: Toggle off "auto-renewal". You'll be asked to confirm your decision. Your Fortnite Crew subscription will be cancelled.

steps.title: Cancel using a web browser (optional).
steps.content: Cancel using a web browser (optional). If you want to cancel your subscription another way, you can use a web browser. Do the following: Go to https://account.microsoft.com/account . Sign into your Microsoft account. Select Services & Subscriptions . Select Manage next to Fortnite Crew . Select Turn off recurring billing .

steps.title: Open the Settings.
steps.content: Open the Settings. This is the cog icon. [2] X Research source Use this method if you purchased the Fortnite Crew subscription with a PlayStation 5 console.

steps.title: Select Users and Accounts.
steps.content: Select Users and Accounts . You can find this below Network .

steps.title: Select Accounts.
steps.content: Select Accounts . This is the first option.

steps.title: Select Payment and Subscriptions.
steps.content: Select Payment and Subscriptions . This will be underneath Profile .

steps.title: Select Game and App Services.
steps.content: Select Game and App Services . You can find this at the very bottom of the page.

steps.title: Locate Fortnite Crew.
steps.content: Locate Fortnite Crew. Your subscriptions should be listed in the order obtained.

steps.title: Select Turn Off Auto-Renew.
steps.content: Select Turn Off Auto-Renew . You'll be asked to confirm your decision. Your Fortnite Crew subscription will be cancelled.

steps.title: Open the Settings.
steps.content: Open the Settings. This is the cog icon. Use this method if you purchased the Fortnite Crew subscription with a PlayStation 4 console.

steps.title: Select Account Management.
steps.content: Select Account Management . You can find this underneath Accessibility .

steps.title: Select Account Information.
steps.content: Select Account Information . This is below Sign Out .

steps.title: Select Services List.
steps.content: Select Services List . This will be underneath PlayStation Subscriptions .

steps.title: Locate Fortnite Crew.
steps.content: Locate Fortnite Crew. Your subscriptions should be listed in the order obtained.

steps.title: Select Turn Off Auto-Renew.
steps.content: Select Turn Off Auto-Renew . You'll be asked to confirm your decision. Your Fortnite Crew subscription will be cancelled.

steps.title: Launch the eShop on your Nintendo Switch.
steps.content: Launch the eShop on your Nintendo Switch . Press the Home button and select the shopping bag icon. Depending on your settings, you may need to enter your login information. Use this method if you purchased the Fortnite Crew subscription through the Nintendo eShop .

steps.title: Select your account icon.
steps.content: Select your account icon. This will be in the top-right corner of the screen.

steps.title: Select Your Subscriptions.
steps.content: Select Your Subscriptions . You can find this in the left panel.

steps.title: Find "Fortnite Crew".
steps.content: Find "Fortnite Crew". The subscriptions will be listed in alphabetical order.

steps.title: Select Turn Off Automatic Renewal.
steps.content: Select Turn Off Automatic Renewal . You'll be asked to confirm your decision. Your Fortnite Crew subscription will be cancelled.

steps.title: Cancel using a web browser (optional).
steps.content: Cancel using a web browser (optional). If you want to cancel your subscription another way, you can use a web browser. Do the following: Go to https://ec.nintendo.com/my/rights . Sign into your Nintendo account. Find the Fortnite Crew subscription. Click Turn Off Automatic Renewal .

steps.title: Open the Galaxy Store.
steps.content: Open the Galaxy Store. You can find this on your home screen or app drawer. [3] X Research source

steps.title: Tap Menu.
steps.content: Tap Menu . You can find this at the bottom-right corner of the screen.

steps.title: Tap Subscriptions.
steps.content: Tap Subscriptions . A list of apps will open.

steps.title: Tap Fortnite.
steps.content: Tap Fortnite . The apps will be listed in alphabetical order.

steps.title: Tap Unsubscribe.
steps.content: Tap Unsubscribe . You'll be asked to confirm your decision. Your Fortnite Crew subscription will be cancelled.
